title: Pomegranate Wine

ingredients.name: simple syrup or pomegranate juice (optional, for sweetening)

steps: Day 1: Sanitize all equipment, work area, and hands.
Wash and peel 6-8 large pomegranates, removing peel and membranes. Keep only the arils (seeds).
Mash the pomegranate arils using a potato masher or ricer over a fermenting bucket to catch all juice.
Blend white grapes in a food processor to extract juice. Add to bucket.
Add sugar to a stock pot with 1 gallon (3785g) water. Whisk and simmer over low heat until sugar dissolves and syrup is hot but not boiling.
Pour hot sugar water over mashed fruit.
Once cool, add pomegranate molasses, acid blend, tannin, and pectic enzyme.
Crush 1 campden tablet between two spoons and stir into the must. Take an SG reading with hydrometer (optional).
Cover bucket with breathable fabric secured with rubber band. Set aside for 24 hours.
Day 2: Using a sterilized spoon, stir yeast nutrient and half of the yeast packet into the must. Cover and set aside.
Day 3+: Stir daily and take SG readings.
When SG reaches 1.030 (day 4-7), remove mesh bag from bucket, squeeze juice back in, discard seeds.
Rack (transfer) juice into a 1-gallon carboy, leaving space for expansion.
Fill airlock halfway with sanitizer solution or water. Fit airlock into bung or screw cap.
Store carboy away from heat and direct sunlight between 70-85°F.
After 3 weeks, when SG is around 1.000, transfer wine into clean carboy, leaving sediment behind.
Allow wine to clear 1-3 months, re-racking into clean carboy each time.
Once clear, taste wine. If sweetening is desired, add ¼-⅓ cup simple syrup or pomegranate juice and ½ tsp wine stabilizer.
Take final SG reading and calculate ABV using formula: (Original SG - Final SG) × 131.25 = ABV%.
Add 1 crushed campden tablet to wine and stir until dissolved.
Bottle the wine and label with type, date, and alcohol percentage.
Age for at least 6 months before enjoying.
notes: Volume conversions: 6-8 pomegranates yield about 5 cups arils, 1 gallon water ≈ 3785g, 2 cups grapes ≈ 300g, 4 cups sugar ≈ 907g, 2 tbsp molasses ≈ 30g, 2 tsp acid blend ≈ 6g, 1 tsp pectic enzyme ≈ 3g, ¼ tsp tannin ≈ 2g, ½ packet yeast ≈ 3g, 1½ tsp nutrient ≈ 5g
Total time is approximately 90 days minimum (3 months fermenting/clearing + 6 months aging)
Taking SG readings on day 1 and before bottling allows ABV calculation (optional but recommended)
Pour extra must in smaller bottle with airlock to top off larger jar during re-racking
Add sediment to compost bin or dilute with water for garden use
Serve chilled rather than at room temperature
Flip-top bottles are a cheaper alternative to wine bottles, corks, and corker
